pages.text: While originally created as a set of playing cards, that use for these cards has faded into obscurity. They are often associated with telling fortunes, and we will discuss the meanings of them here.
The Enderman, a horrific spiritual entity. This card signifies that one may have some ties to the outer realms...
The Diamond, a priceless jewel, this signifies that one has been given a good fortune. If reversed however, one will run into bad luck.
The Iron Golem, a staunch protector of those in need, this card signifies that one may have great ties to the material world.
The Wither Skeleton, the remains of a human soul, set to forever haunt the halls of former Demonic fortresses, often signifies that one may have ties with demons themselves...
The Star, a celestial body in the realms above, this signifies one may have ties to realms one can only dream of...
The Nitwit, also known as the village idiot. This card, while being seemingly insulting, seems to be a gauge of sorts, for magical capacity.
The Moon, a very potent celestial object, and often associated with silver, and femininity, this card may signify one is a creature of the night...
The Silver Sword, a weapon often used to bring the supernatural and paranormal to it's knees, may suggest someone is after you...
The Hermit, a reclusive individual, seems to be associated with the unknown. If this card is in your deck, it may signify you or someone else is dead, and refuses to move on...
There are more cards in your deck, but you have yet to figure out all of their meanings...
